result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:50 PM 
Defendant Steven Charles Le May in court.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Steven Charles Le May.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Mutchler calls the case and states appearances.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

12:16 PM Defendant Steven Charles Le May appeared by video in custody.   Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Taylor soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Dodge would ask that the warrant be quashed.
Warrant had been filed with the criminal complaint.
Defendant is informed of his right to be represented by counsel.
Atty Soule informs the Court that the defendant is not currently public defender eligible.
Defendant will hire is how attorney.
ADA Dodge would ask for a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.
ADA Dodge would ask that the defendant's weapons remain in the possession of the Portage County Sherriff's Dept. during the pendency of this case.
Atty Soule does not object to the request of the signature bond.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant quashed 
Court sets the $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated
Initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
